Function.Description: The globalBinding function returns the first global symbol bound to the specified value.

Brief.Overview: The globalBinding function returns the first global symbol bound to the specified value. If there is no global symbol bound to this value, #void is returned.
Brief.Usage: The globalBinding function serves as a way to get the symbol that corresponds to a value.

Argument.Name: value
Argument.Note: A value whose global symbol is to be returned.

Syntax.Return: Returns an object vector containing currently active symbols in the workspace.
